titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Demby Papers, 1986-2008 RL.10189
titlestmt.author: Janice Hansen and Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-01 15:11:26 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The William Demby Papers contain four versions of his unpublished work of fiction, "King Comus." It also contains a lengthy interview transcript, personal documents, biographical writings, a small amount of correspondence, and various other documents.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: William Demby (1922-2013) was the author of "Beetlecreek," "The Catacombs," and "Love Story Black." Demby's education was interrupted by World War II, when he served in Italy. He resumed his studies and then returned to Italy to marry Lucia Drudi. He married civil rights attorney Barbara Ann Morris after the death of his first wife and split his time between Florence, Italy and Sag Harbor, NY.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Demby Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The William Demby Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2014.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Most notable in the William Demby Papers are his unfinished novel, "King Comus," and a lengthy interview transcript from 2008. The collection also contains miscellaneous correspondence, personal documents, and research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2014-0190

controlaccess.subject: American literature -- African American authors -- History and criticism theory, etc.
African American authors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interview took place from July 12-14, 2008 in Sag Harbor, NY. Unedited transcript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes marriage and death certificates and a Permit of Stay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "Celebration of the Life of William Demby."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various emails, letters, postcards, and faxes.

did.unittitle: 1986 Supplement to The Woodson Source Book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By Gregory Lewis, nephew of William Demby. Details his fight for equality in the work force.
